provided data, it appears to be a JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) file containing detailed information about a government procurement notice from the Canadian government. I will break down the data into several sections and format it for clarity. Here's the reformatted output in JSON format:
full_summary:
=====================================

**Notice for the Solicitation of Naval Architect and Construction Quality Advisor Services - Mingan Archipelago National Park Reserve**

**Tender Reference:** 5P468-24-0004/A

**Publication Date:** 2024-04-25

**Closing Date:** 2024-05-23T14:00:00

**Background:**
Parks Canada Agency is seeking the services of a naval architecture firm to provide technical assistance and advice during the construction of a hovercraft barge by a selected contractor. The services will support the contractor from the date of contract award until March 31, 2028.

**Bid Requirements:**
The selected firm must be capable of providing the required technical assistance and advice to ensure the successful completion of the project. Bidders are expected to possess expertise in naval architecture and relevant industry experience. All bids must be submitted in accordance with the terms and conditions outlined in the solicitation documents.

**Bid Closing and Submission Instructions:**
Bids will only be accepted by email or fax, and not by in-person or courier delivery. The email address for bid submissions is **soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca**. Emails with links to bid documents will not be accepted, and all bid documents must be sent as email attachments. The maximum email file size that Parks Canada can receive is 15 megabytes.

**Quotations and Pre-Qualification:**
Bidders must meet the following minimum qualifications to be considered:

* Experience in providing technical services in naval architecture
* Relevant industry experience and certifications
* Ability to meet the bid schedule and delivery requirements

**Regulatory Requirements:**
The successful bidder will be required to ensure all work is performed in accordance with the National Park Act and all relevant laws and regulations.

**Additional Information:**
All enquiries regarding this solicitation must be submitted in writing and received no later than 8 business days prior to the closing date. Late submissions will not be considered. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

**Tender Documents:**
The tender documents, including the terms and conditions, bid evaluation criteria, and other relevant information, can be obtained at **http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities**. Addenda, when issued, will also be available from this website.

The tender documents are available in both English and French, and any discrepancies between the two languages should be reported to the Contracting Authority.

Contact Information:
Anniki Piché
An
